channel.title: Objects that pre-exist
channel.description: Where do the pre-existing world objects come from? The client?

item.title: Objects that pre-exist
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

The map index file (within the map archive, 4) contains attributes of a terrain:

  • coordinate hash code
  • object file id
  • terrain file id
  • preload flag

Knowing this information you can parse terrains and object information for every position on the map (that isn’t hard-coded, obviously)

  • terrain parsing:

    • reads attribute ids from the terrain file that denote when that terrain should be marked (0 and 1) using your traversal map (this is used for clipping), you can mark blocked tiles and bridges using this information.

  • object parsing:

    • reads an unsigned byte which is packed with information about the object (type, orientation), this can be used to mark walls, larger objects etc not traversable.

The client contains all of this information and how this data should be parsed, this wa s a very basic rundown of how it works. If you have any other questions feel free to ask.

Read full topic

item.title: Objects that pre-exist
item.dc:creator: @FusionLord FusionLord
item.description:
@FusionLord wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:546708”][quote author=FusionLord link=topic=665606.msg4449795#msg4449795 date=1410687214]
I was setting up a mining skill very rs like where it replaces the vein with empty rocks… that then turn back into a vein… it is just awkward that the vein rotates…
[/quote]
You can take a long and slow route about it, but you could map all the mining rocks and get the rotation of the rock from before it gets replaced (by spawning an object and changing that one’s rotating) and then get the rotation needed for the empty rock…
Save all that in an external file or similar, then load it once for the rock data and then the server has all the rocks set up.[/quote]

Do you know where object clicking is sent from the client… I could write the rotation to the packet and read it on the other side…

Read full topic

item.title: Objects that pre-exist
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

FusionLord:

I was setting up a mining skill very rs like where it replaces the vein with empty rocks… that then turn back into a vein… it is just awkward that the vein rotates…

You can take a long and slow route about it, but you could map all the mining rocks and get the rotation of the rock from before it gets replaced (by spawning an object and changing that one’s rotating) and then get the rotation needed for the empty rock…
Save all that in an external file or similar, then load it once for the rock data and then the server has all the rocks set up.

Read full topic

item.title: Objects that pre-exist
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

FusionLord:

well… does the client not send all of the properties of the objects… only the id, x, and y. the only one I am after is direction/ rotation.

The client doesn’t send rotation, or at least I’ve never seen anything where it would…
You can dump the data from the client (you might have to find out what variable is rotation…) and then parse it in your server, but there are kind of a lot of objects.

Read full topic

item.title: Objects that pre-exist
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

FusionLord:

Is it known what file in the cache the objects are loaded from?.. I am using Asteria 2.0 .

There isn’t one specific file. Each map region has 2 files in the cache. One that defines the terrain, and one that defines all objects for that region.

Read full topic
